events.title: Opening of the Stockton and Darlington Railway
events.description: The Stockton and Darlington Railway, the world's first public railway to use steam locomotives, officially opened in England.
events.significance: Marked a major milestone in the Industrial Revolution, revolutionizing transport and commerce.

events.title: Albert Einstein's Annus Mirabilis
events.description: Albert Einstein's paper on the photoelectric effect was published, contributing to the development of quantum theory.
events.significance: Laid foundational work for quantum mechanics, earning Einstein the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

events.title: Lebanon Hostage Crisis Begins
events.description: Islamic militants kidnapped American businessman William Buckley in Beirut, marking the start of a series of hostage crises in Lebanon.
events.significance: Highlighted the complexities of Middle East conflicts and impacted U.S. foreign policy in the region.

events.title: The Taliban capture Kabul
events.description: The Taliban seized control of the Afghan capital Kabul, establishing a regime that ruled Afghanistan for several years.
events.significance: Significantly altered Afghanistan's political landscape and had lasting impacts on global security and geopolitics.
